title: Rewrite Summit Uprising
outcome: Citizens, frustrated with manual BCI oversight, organize a citywide 'Rewrite Summit,' demanding direct say over scoring rules. Intensely public debates erupt; some districts pilot new, locally-designed score systems. Council loses control as neighborhoods diverge, tensions flare, and the city's social fabric fractures along new lines.

events.description: Citizen coalitions launch the rewrite of BCI rules in open-air assemblies, projecting new proposals in public squares and calling for citywide debates.
Neighborhood groups vote on localized versions of BCI scoring, trialing citizen-crafted rules. Conflicts arise between adjacent districts over fairness, causing friction and confusion.

Council factions urgently meet, but fail to devise a unified response. Harmonists plead for order, while Innovators vow to support the best citizen solutions. Directorate officials threaten intervention.
Minor clashes break out at district borders as people contest which scoring rules should apply. Old citywide routines splinter as daily life becomes unpredictable.
Media show fractured city, interviews with people thriving under new assemblies and those fearing chaos. Council's authority appears irreparably weakened as parallel systems become entrenched.
